moves.1. e4: My opponent opens with a standard e4
moves.2. Bc4: not my choice move but i guess there are worse moves out there.
moves.3. exd5: Personally i think this variation only benefits Black.
moves.3... cxd5 4. Bb5+: enticing the further exchange of pieces...
moves.4... Bd7 5. Bxd7+ Nxd7: So now both light squared bishops are off the board.
moves.7. Nf3 e6 8. O-O Bd6: Aiming down at the h2 square. I'm also getting ready to get my Rook over to the c file.
moves.9. b3 Qc7: Piling up on the h2 square.
moves.10. Bb2: The fianchetto doesn't really help white out in this situation, in my opinion. The bishop is blocked by his own pawn.
moves.10... Rc8: Now i have a couple threats at c2 and h2.
moves.11. Nc3: Blocks the c2 threat and develops.
moves.11... Ng4: Further pressure is added to h2. I think my position is looking rather nice right about now.
moves.12... h5: The Knight is poisoned, taking will result in a worse position for white.
moves.13. hxg4: Unfortunately for him, he doesn't see the danger in taking.
moves.13... hxg4: Threatening the capture of the Knight. More importantly, it opens the h file for my Rook. White is in some serious trouble...
moves.14. Ne5: An attempt to block off the diagonal; however, white's fate is sealed.
